verse.text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the chosen ones who live as resident aliens in the Diaspora throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia.

You have been chosen according to the pre-planning of God the Father, by the setting apart of the Spirit, for obedience and for the sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: May grace and peace be multiplied to you.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his abundant mercy, he has begotten us anew into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead—
into an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in the heavens for you.
By the power of God, you are being garrisoned through faith for a deliverance ready to be unveiled in the final moment of time.
You exult in this, even if for a little while it has been necessary for you to be grieved by various trials.

These come so that the refined quality of your faith—far more precious than gold which perishes even though it is refined by fire—may be found to result in praise, glory, and honor at the unveiling of Jesus Christ.
Though you have not seen him, you love him; though you do not see him now, you believe in him and exult with an inexpressible and glorified joy,
as you receive the goal of your faith: the deliverance of your souls.
Concerning this deliverance, the prophets who prophesied about the grace intended for you searched and scrutinized intently.

They were trying to find out what person or what time the Spirit of Christ within them was indicating when he testified in advance to the sufferings destined for Christ and the glories that would follow.

It was revealed to them that they were serving these things not for themselves, but for you. These things have now been announced to you through those who brought you the good news by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven—things into which even angels long to stoop and look.
Therefore, girding up the loins of your mind and being perfectly level-headed, set your hope completely on the grace being brought to you at the unveiling of Jesus Christ.
As children of obedience, do not be shaped by the desires you had back when you were ignorant.
Instead, just as the one who called you is holy, you yourselves must become holy in your entire way of life,
because it stands written: “You shall be holy, because I am holy.”
And if you call upon him as Father—the one who judges each person’s work without favoritism—conduct yourselves with reverence during the time of your stay as resident aliens.
For you know that you were not redeemed from the futile way of life handed down by your ancestors with perishable things like silver or gold,
but with the precious blood of Christ, like that of a lamb without blemish or spot.
He was foreknown before the foundation of the world but was revealed in these final times for your sake.
Through him you are faithful to God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.
Now that you have purified your souls by your obedience to the truth, leading to a sincere love for the brothers and sisters, love one another earnestly from the heart.
For you have been begotten anew, not from perishable seed but from imperishable, through the living and enduring word of God.

For: “All flesh is like grass, and all its glory like the flower of the grass. The grass withers, and the flower falls away, 25 but the word of the Lord endures forever.” And this is the word that was preached as good news to you.
Stripping away all malice, then, and every kind of deceit, theatrical acting, envies, and all forms of backstabbing,
like newborn babies, crave the unadulterated milk of the Word, so that by it you may grow into salvation—
if, indeed, you have tasted that the Lord is kind.
Come to him, a living stone—rejected by humans, it is true, but in God’s sight chosen and precious.
You yourselves, as living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy order of priests, to offer up spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
For it stands written in Scripture: “Look! I am placing a chosen, precious cornerstone in Zion, and the one who trusts in him will never be put to shame.”
This honor, then, belongs to you who trust; but for those who do not trust: “The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone,”
and “A stone that causes stumbling and a rock that trips people up.” They stumble because they disobey the Word; they were destined for this very thing.

But you are a chosen family, a royal order of priests, a holy nation, a people set apart as a treasure, so that you might broadcast the mighty acts of the one who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.

text.q: Once you were not a people, but now you are God’s people; you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.

verse.text: Beloved ones, I urge you as resident aliens and visiting strangers to keep your distance from those animalistic impulses that wage war against the soul.
Maintain a beautiful way of life among the outsiders so that, even when they slander you as criminals, they may see your good works and glorify God on the day of inspection.
Place yourselves under the authority of every human institution for the Lord’s sake—whether to the Emperor as the supreme leader,
or to governors as those sent by him to bring justice to criminals and to give recognition to those who do good.
For this is God’s will: that by doing good you should silence the ignorant talk of foolish people.
Live as free people, yet do not use your freedom as a veil for malice, but live as God’s slaves.
Give honor to everyone: love the brotherhood of believers, fear God, honor the Emperor.
You domestic slaves, place yourselves under the authority of your masters with all respect—not only to those who are good and gentle, but also to the crooked ones.
For this is a mark of grace: if, because of a consciousness of God, someone endures the pain of suffering unjustly.
For what credit is there if you endure a beating for doing wrong? But if you endure suffering for doing good, this is grace in the sight of God.
For you were called to this, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving behind a writing-template for you, so that you might follow in his tracks.

text.q: He committed no sin, nor was any deceit found in his mouth.

verse.text: When he was insulted, he did not return the insult; when he suffered, he did not threaten, but he kept entrusting himself to the one who judges justly.
He himself carried our sins in his body onto the wood, so that we might depart from sins and live for justice; by his bruise you were healed.
For you were wandering like sheep, but now you have returned to the Shepherd and Guardian of your souls.
Likewise, wives, order yourselves under your own husbands, so that even if some are disobedient to the word, they will be won over without a word through the way of life of their wives,
as they observe your pure conduct characterized by reverence.
Your adornment should not be the external kind—the braiding of hair and the wearing of gold jewelry or the putting on of fine robes—
but rather the hidden person of the heart, clothed in the imperishable quality of a spirit of gentle strength and quietness, which is very precious in the sight of God.
For this is how the holy women of the past, who put their hope in God, used to adorn themselves, ordering themselves under their own husbands,
just as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him "lord." You have become her children by doing good and not being intimidated by any terror.

Husbands, likewise, live together with your wives according to understanding, assigning honor to the feminine vessel as the physically weaker one, since you are also fellow-heirs of the gift of life, so that your prayers are not hindered.
Finally, all of you be like-minded, sympathetic, loving as family, tender-hearted, and humble-minded.
Do not return evil for evil or insult for insult, but on the contrary, give a blessing, because you were called to this so that you might inherit a blessing.
For, "The one who desires to love life and to see good days, must keep his tongue from evil and his lips from speaking deceit;

text.q: he must turn away from evil and do good; he must seek peace and pursue it.
For the eyes of the Lord are upon the just, and his ears are open to their prayer, but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil."

verse.text: And who is the one who will harm you if you become zealots for the good?
But even if you should suffer for the sake of justice, you are blessed. "Do not fear what they fear, and do not be shaken,"
but set apart Christ as Lord in your hearts, always ready to give a reasoned defense to everyone who asks you for an account of the hope that is in you.
But do this with gentle strength and reverence, keeping a good conscience, so that in the very thing for which you are slandered, those who insult your good way of life in Christ may be put to shame.
For it is better to suffer for doing good, if the will of God should so intend, than for doing evil.
For Christ also suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust, so that he might bring you to God—being put to death in the realm of the flesh but made alive in the realm of the spirit.
In that realm, he also went and made a proclamation to the spirits in prison,
verse.note: In the 1st-century context, especially influenced by the Book of Enoch (which Peter alludes to elsewhere), this refers to the fallen angels or "Watchers" associated with the rebellion before the Flood.

verse.text: who were once disobedient when God’s patience was waiting in the days of Noah while the ark was being constructed. In it, a few—that is, eight souls—were brought safely through water.
This water prefigured the baptism that now saves you—not the scrubbing of dirt from the body, but the pledge of a good conscience toward God—through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
who has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God, with angels and authorities and powers having been ordered under him.
Since Christ, then, suffered in the flesh, you must also arm yourselves with the same resolve; for the one who has suffered in the flesh is finished with sin.
As a result, you should live the remainder of your time in the flesh no longer by human cravings, but by the will of God.
For you have already spent enough time carrying out the desire of the nations: living in unbridled lusts, cravings, drunkenness, wild parties, drinking bouts, and lawless idolatries.
They find it strange that you no longer run with them into this same flood of dissipation, and so they malign you.
But they will have to give an account to the one who stands ready to judge the living and the dead.
For this is why the good news was proclaimed even to the dead, so that although they were judged by human standards in the flesh, they might live by God’s standards in the spirit.
The end of all things has drawn near. Therefore, be sound-minded and stay sober for the sake of your prayers.
Above all, maintain an intense love for one another, because “love covers a multitude of sins.”
Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.
As each one has received a *charisma*, serve one another with it as good stewards of the diverse grace of God.

If anyone speaks, let them speak as one uttering the oracles of God; if anyone serves, let them do so from the strength that God provides. This way, in all things, God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom belongs the glory and the power forever and ever. Amen.
Beloved, do not be surprised by the smelting fire among you that is happening for your testing, as though something strange were happening to you.
Instead, to the degree that you share in the sufferings of Christ, rejoice, so that you may also rejoice with exultation at the revealing of his glory.
If you are insulted for the name of Christ, you are honored, because the Spirit of glory—the Spirit of God—rests upon you.
Let none of you suffer as a murderer, a thief, an evildoer, or as a social meddler.
But if anyone suffers as a "Christian," let them not be ashamed, but let them glorify God in that name.
For the time has come for judgment to begin with the household of God; and if it begins first with us, what will be the end for those who disobey the good news of God?

text.q: “And if the just person is saved only with difficulty, where will the godless and the sinner appear?”

verse.text: Therefore, let those who suffer according to the will of God entrust their lives to a faithful Creator by continuing to do what is good.
So, I appeal to the elders among you, as a fellow-elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, as well as a partner in the splendor that is about to be revealed:

shepherd the flock of God that is in your care. Exercise oversight not because you are forced to, but willingly, as God would have it; not out of a greedy desire for shameful gain, but with a ready heart.
Do not act like petty tyrants over those entrusted to your care, but become living models for the flock.
And when the Chief Shepherd is revealed, you will receive the amaranthine crown of splendor.

In the same way, you younger people, align yourselves under the elders. And all of you, tie on the apron of humility toward one another, because "God sets himself against the arrogant, but gives grace to the humble."
Therefore, humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, so that he may lift you up in due time,
throwing all your anxiety upon him, because he cares for you.
Keep a clear head; stay awake! Your legal adversary, the Accuser, stalks around like a roaring lion, looking for someone to swallow whole.
Stand against him, solid in your faith, knowing that the same kind of sufferings are being brought to completion by your brotherhood throughout the world.
After you have suffered for a little while, the God of all grace—who called you into his eternal splendor in Christ—will himself repair, establish, strengthen, and ground you.
To him belongs the sovereign power throughout the ages. Amen.
Through Silvanus, whom I regard as a faithful brother, I have written to you briefly, encouraging you and testifying that this is the true grace of God. Stand fast in it!
She who is chosen along with you in "Babylon" sends you greetings, as does my son, Mark.
Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace to all of you who are in Christ.
